1.text: And Abraham was old, and well stricken in age: and the LORD had blessed Abraham in all things.

2.text: And Abraham said unto his eldest servant of his house, that ruled over all that he had, Put, I pray you, your hand under my thigh:

3.text: And I will make you swear by the LORD, the God of heaven, and the God of the earth, that you shall not take a wife unto my son of the daughters of the Canaanites, among whom I dwell:

4.text: But you shall go unto my country, and to my kindred, and take a wife unto my son Isaac.

5.text: And the servant said unto him, Possibly the woman will not be willing to follow me unto this land: must I essentially bring your son again unto the land from whence you came?

6.text: And Abraham said unto him, Beware you that you bring not my son thither again.

7.text: The LORD God of heaven, which took me from my father's house, and from the land of my kindred, and which spoke unto me, and that swore unto me, saying, Unto your seed will I give this land; he shall send his angel before you, and you shall take a wife unto my son from thence.

8.text: And if the woman will not be willing to follow you, then you shall be clear from this my oath: only bring not my son thither again.

9.text: And the servant put his hand under the thigh of Abraham his master, and swore to him concerning that matter.

10.text: And the servant took ten camels of the camels of his master, and departed; for all the goods of his master were in his hand: and he arose, and went to Mesopotamia, unto the city of Nahor.

11.text: And he made his camels to kneel down without the city by a well of water at the time of the evening, even the time that women go out to draw water.

12.text: And he said O LORD God of my master Abraham, I pray you, send me good speed this day, and show kindness unto my master Abraham.

13.text: Behold, I stand here by the well of water; and the daughters of the men of the city come out to draw water:

14.text: And let it come to pass, that the damsel to whom I shall say, Let down your pitcher, I pray you, that I may drink; and she shall say, Drink, and I will give your camels drink also: let the same be she that you have appointed for your servant Isaac; and thereby shall I know that you have showed kindness unto my master.

15.text: And it came to pass, before he had done speaking, that, behold, Rebekah came out, who was born to Bethuel, son of Milcah, the wife of Nahor, Abraham's brother, with her pitcher upon her shoulder.

16.text: And the damsel was very fair to look upon, a virgin, neither had any man known her: and she went down to the well, and filled her pitcher, and came up.

17.text: And the servant ran to meet her, and said, Let me, I pray you, drink a little water of your pitcher.

18.text: And she said, Drink, my lord: and she hasted, and let down her pitcher upon her hand, and gave him drink.

19.text: And when she had done giving him drink, she said, I will draw water for your camels also, until they have done drinking.

20.text: And she hasted, and emptied her pitcher into the gutter, and ran again unto the well to draw water, and drew for all his camels.

21.text: And the man wondering at her held his peace, to know whether the LORD had made his journey prosperous or not.

22.text: And it came to pass, as the camels had done drinking, that the man took a golden earring of half a shekel weight, and two bracelets for her hands of ten shekels weight of gold;

23.text: And said, Whose daughter are you? tell me, I pray you: is there room in your father's house for us to lodge in?

24.text: And she said unto him, I am the daughter of Bethuel the son of Milcah, which she bare unto Nahor.

25.text: She said moreover unto him, We have both straw and animal food enough, and room to lodge in.

26.text: And the man bowed down his head, and worshipped the LORD.

27.text: And he said, Blessed be the LORD God of my master Abraham, who has not left destitute my master of his mercy and his truth: I being in the way, the LORD led me to the house of my master's brethren.

28.text: And the damsel ran, and told them of her mother's house these things.

29.text: And Rebekah had a brother, and his name was Laban: and Laban ran out unto the man, unto the well.

30.text: And it came to pass, when he saw the earring and bracelets upon his sister's hands, and when he heard the words of Rebekah his sister, saying, Thus spoke the man unto me; that he came unto the man; and, behold, he stood by the camels at the well.

31.text: And he said, Come in, you blessed of the LORD; wherefore stand you without? for I have prepared the house, and room for the camels.

32.text: And the man came into the house: and he unbounded his camels, and gave straw and animal food for the camels, and water to wash his feet, and the men's feet that were with him.

33.text: And there was set food before him to eat: but he said, I will not eat, until I have told mine errand. And he said, Speak on.

34.text: And he said, I am Abraham's servant.

35.text: And the LORD has blessed my master greatly; and he is become great: and he has given him flocks, and herds, and silver, and gold, and male servants, and maidservants, and camels, and asses.

36.text: And Sarah my master's wife bare a son to my master when she was old: and unto him has he given all that he has.

37.text: And my master made me swear, saying, You shall not take a wife to my son of the daughters of the Canaanites, in whose land I dwell:

38.text: But you shall go unto my father's house, and to my kindred, and take a wife unto my son.

39.text: And I said unto my master, Possibly the woman will not follow me.

40.text: And he said unto me, The LORD, before whom I walk, will send his angel with you, and prosper your way; and you shall take a wife for my son of my kindred, and of my father's house:

41.text: Then shall you be clear from this my oath, when you come to my kindred; and if they give not you one, you shall be clear from my oath.

42.text: And I came this day unto the well, and said, O LORD God of my master Abraham, if now you do prosper my way which I go:

43.text: Behold, I stand by the well of water; and it shall come to pass, that when the virgin comes forth to draw water, and I say to her, Give me, I pray you, a little water of your pitcher to drink;

44.text: And she say to me, Both drink you, and I will also draw for your camels: let the same be the woman whom the LORD has appointed out for my master's son.

45.text: And before I had done speaking in mine heart, behold, Rebekah came forth with her pitcher on her shoulder; and she went down unto the well, and drew water: and I said unto her, Let me drink, I pray you.

46.text: And she made haste, and let down her pitcher from her shoulder, and said, Drink, and I will give your camels drink also: so I drank, and she made the camels drink also.

47.text: And I asked her, and said, Whose daughter are you? And she said, the daughter of Bethuel, Nahor's son, whom Milcah bare unto him: and I put the earring upon her face, and the bracelets upon her hands.

48.text: And I bowed down my head, and worshipped the LORD, and blessed the LORD God of my master Abraham, which had led me in the right way to take my master's brother's daughter unto his son.

49.text: And now if all of you will deal kindly and truly with my master, tell me: and if not, tell me; that I may turn to the right hand, or to the left.

50.text: Then Laban and Bethuel answered and said, The thing proceeds from the LORD: we cannot speak unto you bad or good.

51.text: Behold, Rebekah is before you, take her, and go, and let her be your master's son's wife, as the LORD has spoken.

52.text: And it came to pass, that, when Abraham's servant heard their words, he worshipped the LORD, bowing himself to the earth.

53.text: And the servant brought forth jewels of silver, and jewels of gold, and raiment, and gave them to Rebekah: he gave also to her brother and to her mother precious things.

54.text: And they did eat and drink, he and the men that were with him, and tarried all night; and they rose up in the morning, and he said, Send me away unto my master.

55.text: And her brother and her mother said, Let the damsel abide with us a few days, at the least ten; after that she shall go.

56.text: And he said unto them, Hinder me not, seeing the LORD has prospered my way; send me away that I may go to my master.

57.text: And they said, We will call the damsel, and enquire at her mouth.

58.text: And they called Rebekah, and said unto her, Will you go with this man? And she said, I will go.

59.text: And they sent away Rebekah their sister, and her nurse, and Abraham's servant, and his men.

60.text: And they blessed Rebekah, and said unto her, You are our sister, be you the mother of thousands of millions, and let your seed possess the gate of those which hate them.

61.text: And Rebekah arose, and her damsels, and they rode upon the camels, and followed the man: and the servant took Rebekah, and went his way.

62.text: And Isaac came from the way of the well Lahairoi; for he dwelt in the south country.

63.text: And Isaac went out to meditate in the field at the evening: and he lifted up his eyes, and saw, and, behold, the camels were coming.

64.text: And Rebekah lifted up her eyes, and when she saw Isaac, she lighted off the camel.

65.text: For she had said unto the servant, What man is this that walks in the field to meet us? And the servant had said, It is my master: therefore she took a vail, and covered herself.

66.text: And the servant told Isaac all things that he had done.

67.text: And Isaac brought her into his mother Sarah's tent, and took Rebekah, and she became his wife; and he loved her: and Isaac was comforted after his mother's death.

1.text: Then again Abraham took a wife, and her name was Keturah.

2.text: And she bare him Zimran, and Jokshan, and Medan, and Midian, and Ishbak, and Shuah.

3.text: And Jokshan brings forth Sheba, and Dedan. And the sons of Dedan were Asshurim, and Letushim, and Leummim.

4.text: And the sons of Midian; Ephah, and Epher, and Hanoch, and Abidah, and Eldaah. All these were the children of Keturah.

5.text: And Abraham gave all that he had unto Isaac.

6.text: But unto the sons of the concubines, which Abraham had, Abraham gave gifts, and sent them away from Isaac his son, while he yet lived, eastward, unto the east country.

7.text: And these are the days of the years of Abraham's life which he lived, an hundred threescore and fifteen years.

8.text: Then Abraham gave up the spirit, and died in a good old age, an old man, and full of years; and was gathered to his people.

9.text: And his sons Isaac and Ishmael buried him in the cave of Machpelah, in the field of Ephron the son of Zohar the Hittite, which is before Mamre;

10.text: The field which Abraham purchased of the sons of Heth: there was Abraham buried, and Sarah his wife.

11.text: And it came to pass after the death of Abraham, that God blessed his son Isaac; and Isaac dwelt by the well Lahairoi.

12.text: Now these are the generations of Ishmael, Abraham's son, whom Hagar the Egyptian, Sarah's handmaid, bare unto Abraham:

13.text: And these are the names of the sons of Ishmael, by their names, according to their generations: the firstborn of Ishmael, Nebajoth; and Kedar, and Adbeel, and Mibsam,

14.text: And Mishma, and Dumah, and Massa,

15.text: Hadar, and Tema, Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah:

16.text: These are the sons of Ishmael, and these are their names, by their towns, and by their castles; twelve princes according to their nations.

17.text: And these are the years of the life of Ishmael, an hundred and thirty and seven years: and he gave up the spirit and died; and was gathered unto his people.

18.text: And they dwelt from Havilah unto Shur, that is before Egypt, as you go toward Assyria: and he died in the presence of all his brethren.

19.text: And these are the generations of Isaac, Abraham's son: Abraham brings forth Isaac:

20.text: And Isaac was forty years old when he took Rebekah to wife, the daughter of Bethuel the Syrian of Padanaram, the sister to Laban the Syrian.

21.text: And Isaac implored the LORD for his wife, because she was barren: and the LORD was implored of him, and Rebekah his wife conceived.

22.text: And the children struggled together within her; and she said, If it be so, why am I thus? And she went to enquire of the LORD.

23.text: And the LORD said unto her, Two nations are in your womb, and two manner of people shall be separated from your bowels; and the one people shall be stronger than the other people; and the elder shall serve the younger.

24.text: And when her days to be delivered were fulfilled, behold, there were twins in her womb.

25.text: And the first came out red, all over like an hairy garment; and they called his name Esau.

26.text: And after that came his brother out, and his hand took hold on Esau's heel; and his name was called Jacob: and Isaac was threescore years old when she bare them.

27.text: And the boys grew: and Esau was a cunning hunter, a man of the field; and Jacob was a plain man, dwelling in tents.

28.text: And Isaac loved Esau, because he did eat of his venison: but Rebekah loved Jacob.

29.text: And Jacob cook pottage: and Esau came from the field, and he was faint:

30.text: And Esau said to Jacob, Feed me, I pray you, with that same red pottage; for I am faint: therefore was his name called Edom.

31.text: And Jacob said, Sell me this day your birthright.

32.text: And Esau said, Behold, I am at the point to die: and what profit shall this birthright do to me?

33.text: And Jacob said, Swear to me this day; and he swore unto him: and he sold his birthright unto Jacob.

34.text: Then Jacob gave Esau bread and pottage of lentils; and he did eat and drink, and rose up, and went his way: thus Esau despised his birthright.

1.text: And there was a famine in the land, beside the first famine that was in the days of Abraham. And Isaac went unto Abimelech king of the Philistines unto Gerar.

2.text: And the LORD appeared unto him, and said, Go not down into Egypt; dwell in the land which I shall tell you of:

3.text: Sojourn in this land, and I will be with you, and will bless you; for unto you, and unto your seed, I will give all these countries, and I will perform the oath which I swore unto Abraham your father;

4.text: And I will make your seed to multiply as the stars of heaven, and will give unto your seed all these countries; and in your seed shall all the nations of the earth be blessed;

5.text: Because that Abraham obeyed my voice, and kept my charge, my commandments, my statutes, and my laws.

6.text: And Isaac dwelt in Gerar:

7.text: And the men of the place asked him of his wife; and he said, She is my sister: for he feared to say, She is my wife; lest, said he, the men of the place should kill me for Rebekah; because she was fair to look upon.

8.text: And it came to pass, when he had been there a long time, that Abimelech king of the Philistines looked out at a window, and saw, and, behold, Isaac was sporting with Rebekah his wife.

9.text: And Abimelech called Isaac, and said, Behold, certainly she is your wife; and how said you, She is my sister? And Isaac said unto him, Because I said, Lest I die for her.

10.text: And Abimelech said, What is this you have done unto us? one of the people might lightly have lien with your wife, and you should have brought guiltiness upon us.

11.text: And Abimelech charged all his people, saying, He that touches this man or his wife shall surely be put to death.

12.text: Then Isaac sowed in that land, and received in the same year an hundredfold: and the LORD blessed him.

13.text: And the man waxed great, and went forward, and grew until he became very great:

14.text: For he had possession of flocks, and possession of herds, and great store of servants: and the Philistines envied him.

15.text: For all the wells which his father's servants had dug in the days of Abraham his father, the Philistines had stopped them, and filled them with earth.

16.text: And Abimelech said unto Isaac, Go from us; for you are much mightier than we.

17.text: And Isaac departed thence, and pitched his tent in the valley of Gerar, and dwelt there.

18.text: And Isaac dug again the wells of water, which they had dug in the days of Abraham his father; for the Philistines had stopped them after the death of Abraham: and he called their names after the names by which his father had called them.

19.text: And Isaac's servants dug in the valley, and found there a well of springing water.

20.text: And the herdmen of Gerar did strive with Isaac's herdmen, saying, The water is ours: and he called the name of the well Esek; because they strove with him.

21.text: And they dug another well, and strove for that also: and he called the name of it Sitnah.

22.text: And he removed from thence, and dug another well; and for that they strove not: and he called the name of it Rehoboth; and he said, For now the LORD has made room for us, and we shall be fruitful in the land.

23.text: And he went up from thence to Beersheba.

24.text: And the LORD appeared unto him the same night, and said, I am the God of Abraham your father: fear not, for I am with you, and will bless you, and multiply your seed for my servant Abraham's sake.

25.text: And he built an altar there, and called upon the name of the LORD, and pitched his tent there: and there Isaac's servants dug a well.

26.text: Then Abimelech went to him from Gerar, and Ahuzzath one of his friends, and Phichol the chief captain of his army.

27.text: And Isaac said unto them, Wherefore come all of you to me, seeing all of you hate me, and have sent me away from you?

28.text: And they said, We saw certainly that the LORD was with you: and we said, Let there be now an oath between us, even between us and you, and let us make a covenant with you;

29.text: That you will do us no hurt, as we have not touched you, and as we have done unto you nothing but good, and have sent you away in peace: you are now the blessed of the LORD.

30.text: And he made them a feast, and they did eat and drink.

31.text: And they rose up early in the morning, and swore one to another: and Isaac sent them away, and they departed from him in peace.

32.text: And it came to pass the same day, that Isaac's servants came, and told him concerning the well which they had dug, and said unto him, We have found water.

33.text: And he called it Shebah: therefore the name of the city is Beersheba unto this day.

34.text: And Esau was forty years old when he took to wife Judith the daughter of Beeri the Hittite, and Bashemath the daughter of Elon the Hittite:

35.text: Which were a grief of mind unto Isaac and to Rebekah.

1.text: And it came to pass, that when Isaac was old, and his eyes were dim, so that he could not see, he called Esau his eldest son, and said unto him, My son: and he said unto him, Behold, here am I.

2.text: And he said, Behold now, I am old, I know not the day of my death:

3.text: Now therefore take, I pray you, your weapons, your quiver and your bow, and go out to the field, and take me some venison;

4.text: And make me savoury food, such as I love, and bring it to me, that I may eat; that my soul may bless you before I die.

5.text: And Rebekah heard when Isaac spoke to Esau his son. And Esau went to the field to hunt for venison, and to bring it.

6.text: And Rebekah spoke unto Jacob her son, saying, Behold, I heard your father speak unto Esau your brother, saying,

7.text: Bring me venison, and make me savoury food, that I may eat, and bless you before the LORD before my death.

8.text: Now therefore, my son, obey my voice according to that which I command you.

9.text: Go now to the flock, and fetch me from thence two good kids of the goats; and I will make them savoury food for your father, such as he loves:

10.text: And you shall bring it to your father, that he may eat, and that he may bless you before his death.

11.text: And Jacob said to Rebekah his mother, Behold, Esau my brother is a hairy man, and I am a smooth man:

12.text: My father possibly will feel me, and I shall seem to him as a deceiver; and I shall bring a curse upon me, and not a blessing.

13.text: And his mother said unto him, Upon me be your curse, my son: only obey my voice, and go fetch me them.

14.text: And he went, and fetched, and brought them to his mother: and his mother made savoury food, such as his father loved.

15.text: And Rebekah took goodly raiment of her eldest son Esau, which were with her in the house, and put them upon Jacob her younger son:

16.text: And she put the skins of the kids of the goats upon his hands, and upon the smooth of his neck:

17.text: And she gave the savoury food and the bread, which she had prepared, into the hand of her son Jacob.

18.text: And he came unto his father, and said, My father: and he said, Here am I; who are you, my son?

19.text: And Jacob said unto his father, I am Esau your first born; I have done according as you bade me: arise, I pray you, sit and eat of my venison, that your soul may bless me.

20.text: And Isaac said unto his son, How is it that you have found it so quickly, my son? And he said, Because the LORD your God brought it to me.

21.text: And Isaac said unto Jacob, Come near, I pray you, that I may feel you, my son, whether you be my very son Esau or not.

22.text: And Jacob went near unto Isaac his father; and he felt him, and said, The voice is Jacob's voice, but the hands are the hands of Esau.

23.text: And he discerned him not, because his hands were hairy, as his brother Esau's hands: so he blessed him.

24.text: And he said, Are you my very son Esau? And he said, I am.

25.text: And he said, Bring it near to me, and I will eat of my son's venison, that my soul may bless you. And he brought it near to him, and he did eat: and he brought him wine and he drank.

26.text: And his father Isaac said unto him, Come near now, and kiss me, my son.

27.text: And he came near, and kissed him: and he smelled the smell of his raiment, and blessed him, and said, See, the smell of my son is as the smell of a field which the LORD has blessed:

28.text: Therefore God give you of the dew of heaven, and the fatness of the earth, and plenty of corn and wine:

29.text: Let people serve you, and nations bow down to you: be lord over your brethren, and let your mother's sons bow down to you: cursed be every one that curses you, and blessed be he that blesses you.

30.text: And it came to pass, as soon as Isaac had made an end of blessing Jacob, and Jacob was yet scarce gone out from the presence of Isaac his father, that Esau his brother came in from his hunting.

31.text: And he also had made savoury food, and brought it unto his father, and said unto his father, Let my father arise, and eat of his son's venison, that your soul may bless me.

32.text: And Isaac his father said unto him, Who are you? And he said, I am your son, your firstborn Esau.

33.text: And Isaac trembled very exceedingly, and said, Who? where is he that has taken venison, and brought it me, and I have eaten of all before you came, and have blessed him? yea, and he shall be blessed.

34.text: And when Esau heard the words of his father, he cried with a great and exceeding bitter cry, and said unto his father, Bless me, even me also, O my father.

35.text: And he said, Your brother came with subtlety, and has taken away your blessing.

36.text: And he said, Is not he rightly named Jacob? for he has supplanted me these two times: he took away my birthright; and, behold, now he has taken away my blessing. And he said, Have you not reserved a blessing for me?

37.text: And Isaac answered and said unto Esau, Behold, I have made him your lord, and all his brethren have I given to him for servants; and with corn and wine have I sustained him: and what shall I do now unto you, my son?

38.text: And Esau said unto his father, Have you but one blessing, my father? bless me, even me also, O my father. And Esau lifted up his voice, and wept.

39.text: And Isaac his father answered and said unto him, Behold, your dwelling shall be the fatness of the earth, and of the dew of heaven from above;

40.text: And by your sword shall you live, and shall serve your brother; and it shall come to pass when you shall have the dominion, that you shall break his yoke from off your neck.

41.text: And Esau hated Jacob because of the blessing wherewith his father blessed him: and Esau said in his heart, The days of mourning for my father are at hand; then will I slay my brother Jacob.

42.text: And these words of Esau her elder son were told to Rebekah: and she sent and called Jacob her younger son, and said unto him, Behold, your brother Esau, as concerning you, does comfort himself, purposing to kill you.

43.text: Now therefore, my son, obey my voice; arise, flee you to Laban my brother to Haran;

44.text: And tarry with him a few days, until your brother's fury turn away;

45.text: Until your brother's anger turn away from you, and he forget that which you have done to him: then I will send, and fetch you from thence: why should I be deprived also of you both in one day?

46.text: And Rebekah said to Isaac, I am weary of my life because of the daughters of Heth: if Jacob take a wife of the daughters of Heth, such as these which are of the daughters of the land, what good shall my life do me?

1.text: And Isaac called Jacob, and blessed him, and charged him, and said unto him, You shall not take a wife of the daughters of Canaan.

2.text: Arise, go to Padanaram, to the house of Bethuel your mother's father; and take you a wife from thence of the daughters of Laban your mother's brother.

3.text: And God Almighty bless you, and make you fruitful, and multiply you, that you may be a multitude of people;

4.text: And give you the blessing of Abraham, to you, and to your seed with you; that you may inherit the land wherein you are a stranger, which God gave unto Abraham.

5.text: And Isaac sent away Jacob: and he went to Padanaram unto Laban, son of Bethuel the Syrian, the brother of Rebekah, Jacob's and Esau's mother.

6.text: When Esau saw that Isaac had blessed Jacob, and sent him away to Padanaram, to take him a wife from thence; and that as he blessed him he gave him a charge, saying, You shall not take a wife of the daughters of Canaan;

7.text: And that Jacob obeyed his father and his mother, and was gone to Padanaram;

8.text: And Esau seeing that the daughters of Canaan pleased not Isaac his father;

9.text: Then went Esau unto Ishmael, and took unto the wives which he had Mahalath the daughter of Ishmael Abraham's son, the sister of Nebajoth, to be his wife.

10.text: And Jacob went out from Beersheba, and went toward Haran.

11.text: And he lighted upon a certain place, and tarried there all night, because the sun was set; and he took of the stones of that place, and put them for his pillows, and lay down in that place to sleep.

12.text: And he dreamed, and behold a ladder set up on the earth, and the top of it reached to heaven: and behold the angels of God ascending and descending on it.

13.text: And, behold, the LORD stood above it, and said, I am the LORD God of Abraham your father, and the God of Isaac: the land whereon you lie, to you will I give it, and to your seed;

14.text: And your seed shall be as the dust of the earth, and you shall spread abroad to the west, and to the east, and to the north, and to the south: and in you and in your seed shall all the families of the earth be blessed.

15.text: And, behold, I am with you, and will keep you in all places where you go, and will bring you again into this land; for I will not leave you, until I have done that which I have spoken to you of.

16.text: And Jacob awaked out of his sleep, and he said, Surely the LORD is in this place; and I knew it not.

17.text: And he was afraid, and said, How dreadful is this place! this is no other but the house of God, and this is the gate of heaven.

18.text: And Jacob rose up early in the morning, and took the stone that he had put for his pillows, and set it up for a pillar, and poured oil upon the top of it.

19.text: And he called the name of that place Bethel: but the name of that city was called Luz at the first.

20.text: And Jacob vowed a vow, saying, If God will be with me, and will keep me in this way that I go, and will give me bread to eat, and raiment to put on,

21.text: So that I come again to my father's house in peace; then shall the LORD be my God:

22.text: And this stone, which I have set for a pillar, shall be God's house: and of all that you shall give me I will surely give the tenth unto you.

1.text: Then Jacob went on his journey, and came into the land of the people of the east.

2.text: And he looked, and behold a well in the field, and, lo, there were three flocks of sheep lying by it; for out of that well they watered the flocks: and a great stone was upon the well's mouth.

3.text: And thither were all the flocks gathered: and they rolled the stone from the well's mouth, and watered the sheep, and put the stone again upon the well's mouth in his place.

4.text: And Jacob said unto them, My brethren, whence be all of you? And they said, Of Haran are we.

5.text: And he said unto them, Know all of you Laban the son of Nahor? And they said, We know him.

6.text: And he said unto them, Is he well? And they said, He is well: and, behold, Rachel his daughter comes with the sheep.

7.text: And he said, Lo, it is yet high day, neither is it time that the cattle should be gathered together: water all of you the sheep, and go and feed them.

8.text: And they said, We cannot, until all the flocks be gathered together, and till they roll the stone from the well's mouth; then we water the sheep.

9.text: And while he yet spoke with them, Rachel came with her father's sheep; for she kept them.

10.text: And it came to pass, when Jacob saw Rachel the daughter of Laban his mother's brother, and the sheep of Laban his mother's brother, that Jacob went near, and rolled the stone from the well's mouth, and watered the flock of Laban his mother's brother.

11.text: And Jacob kissed Rachel, and lifted up his voice, and wept.

12.text: And Jacob told Rachel that he was her father's brother, and that he was Rebekah's son: and she ran and told her father.

13.text: And it came to pass, when Laban heard the tidings of Jacob his sister's son, that he ran to meet him, and embraced him, and kissed him, and brought him to his house. And he told Laban all these things.

14.text: And Laban said to him, Surely you are my bone and my flesh. And he abode with him the space of a month.

15.text: And Laban said unto Jacob, Because you are my brother, should you therefore serve me for nothing? tell me, what shall your wages be?

16.text: And Laban had two daughters: the name of the elder was Leah, and the name of the younger was Rachel.

17.text: Leah was tender eyed; but Rachel was beautiful and well favoured.

18.text: And Jacob loved Rachel; and said, I will serve you seven years for Rachel your younger daughter.

19.text: And Laban said, It is better that I give her to you, than that I should give her to another man: abide with me.

20.text: And Jacob served seven years for Rachel; and they seemed unto him but a few days, for the love he had to her.

21.text: And Jacob said unto Laban, Give me my wife, for my days are fulfilled, that I may go in unto her.

22.text: And Laban gathered together all the men of the place, and made a feast.

23.text: And it came to pass in the evening, that he took Leah his daughter, and brought her to him; and he went in unto her.

24.text: And Laban gave unto his daughter Leah Zilpah his maid for an handmaid.

25.text: And it came to pass, that in the morning, behold, it was Leah: and he said to Laban, What is this you have done unto me? did not I serve with you for Rachel? wherefore then have you misled me?

26.text: And Laban said, It must not be so done in our country, to give the younger before the firstborn.

27.text: Fulfill her week, and we will give you this also for the service which you shall serve with me yet seven other years.

28.text: And Jacob did so, and fulfilled her week: and he gave him Rachel his daughter to wife also.

29.text: And Laban gave to Rachel his daughter Bilhah his handmaid to be her maid.

30.text: And he went in also unto Rachel, and he loved also Rachel more than Leah, and served with him yet seven other years.

31.text: And when the LORD saw that Leah was hated, he opened her womb: but Rachel was barren.

32.text: And Leah conceived, and bare a son, and she called his name Reuben: for she said, Surely the LORD has looked upon my affliction; now therefore my husband will love me.

33.text: And she conceived again, and bare a son; and said, Because the LORD has heard I was hated, he has therefore given me this son also: and she called his name Simeon.

34.text: And she conceived again, and bare a son; and said, Now this time will my husband be joined unto me, because I have born him three sons: therefore was his name called Levi.

35.text: And she conceived again, and bare a son: and she said, Now will I praise the LORD: therefore she called his name Judah; and left bearing.

1.text: And when Rachel saw that she bare Jacob no children, Rachel envied her sister; and said unto Jacob, Give me children, or else I die.

2.text: And Jacob's anger was kindled against Rachel: and he said, Am I in God's position, who has withheld from you the fruit of the womb?

3.text: And she said, Behold my maid Bilhah, go in unto her; and she shall bear upon my knees, that I may also have children by her.

4.text: And she gave him Bilhah her handmaid to wife: and Jacob went in unto her.

5.text: And Bilhah conceived, and bare Jacob a son.

6.text: And Rachel said, God has judged me, and has also heard my voice, and has given me a son: therefore called she his name Dan.

7.text: And Bilhah Rachel's maid conceived again, and bare Jacob a second son.

8.text: And Rachel said, With great wrestlings have I wrestled with my sister, and I have prevailed: and she called his name Naphtali.

9.text: When Leah saw that she had left bearing, she took Zilpah her maid, and gave her Jacob to wife.

10.text: And Zilpah Leah's maid bare Jacob a son.

11.text: And Leah said, A troop comes: and she called his name Gad.

12.text: And Zilpah Leah's maid bare Jacob a second son.

13.text: And Leah said, Happy am I, for the daughters will call me blessed: and she called his name Asher.

14.text: And Reuben went in the days of wheat harvest, and found mandrakes in the field, and brought them unto his mother Leah. Then Rachel said to Leah, Give me, I pray you, of your son's mandrakes.

15.text: And she said unto her, Is it a small matter that you have taken my husband? and would you take away my son's mandrakes also? And Rachel said, Therefore he shall lie with you to night for your son's mandrakes.

16.text: And Jacob came out of the field in the evening, and Leah went out to meet him, and said, You must come in unto me; for surely I have hired you with my son's mandrakes. And he lay with her that night.

17.text: And God hearkened unto Leah, and she conceived, and bare Jacob the fifth son.

18.text: And Leah said, God has given me my hire, because I have given my maiden to my husband: and she called his name Issachar.

19.text: And Leah conceived again, and bare Jacob the sixth son.

20.text: And Leah said, God has imbued me with a good dowry; now will my husband dwell with me, because I have born him six sons: and she called his name Zebulun.

21.text: And afterwards she bare a daughter, and called her name Dinah.

22.text: And God remembered Rachel, and God hearkened to her, and opened her womb.

23.text: And she conceived, and bare a son; and said, God has taken away my reproach:

24.text: And she called his name Joseph; and said, The LORD shall add to me another son.

25.text: And it came to pass, when Rachel had born Joseph, that Jacob said unto Laban, Send me away, that I may go unto mine own place, and to my country.

26.text: Give me my wives and my children, for whom I have served you, and let me go: for you know my service which I have done you.

27.text: And Laban said unto him, I pray you, if I have found favour in yours eyes, tarry: for I have learned by experience that the LORD has blessed me for your sake.

28.text: And he said, Appoint me your wages, and I will give it.

29.text: And he said unto him, You know how I have served you, and how your cattle was with me.

30.text: For it was little which you had before I came, and it is now increased unto a multitude; and the LORD has blessed you since my coming: and now when shall I provide for mine own house also?

31.text: And he said, What shall I give you? And Jacob said, You shall not give me any thing: if you will do this thing for me, I will again feed and keep your flock.

32.text: I will pass through all your flock to day, removing from thence all the speckled and spotted cattle, and all the brown cattle among the sheep, and the spotted and speckled among the goats: and of such shall be my hire.

33.text: So shall my righteousness answer for me in time to come, when it shall come for my hire before your face: every one that is not speckled and spotted among the goats, and brown among the sheep, that shall be counted stolen with me.

34.text: And Laban said, Behold, I would it might be according to your word.

35.text: And he removed that day the he goats that were striped with bands and spotted, and all the she goats that were speckled and spotted, and every one that had some white in it, and all the brown among the sheep, and gave them into the hand of his sons.

36.text: And he set three days' journey between himself and Jacob: and Jacob fed the rest of Laban's flocks.

37.text: And Jacob took him rods of green poplar, and of the hazel and chestnut tree; and stripped white strakes in them, and made the white appear which was in the rods.

38.text: And he set the rods which he had stripped before the flocks in the gutters in the watering troughs when the flocks came to drink, that they should conceive when they came to drink.

39.text: And the flocks conceived before the rods, and brought forth cattle striped with bands, speckled, and spotted.

40.text: And Jacob did separate the lambs, and set the faces of the flocks toward the striped with bands, and all the brown in the flock of Laban; and he put his own flocks by themselves, and put them not unto Laban's cattle.

41.text: And it came to pass, whenever the stronger cattle did conceive, that Jacob laid the rods before the eyes of the cattle in the gutters, that they might conceive among the rods.

42.text: But when the cattle were feeble, he put them not in: so the feebler were Laban's, and the stronger Jacob's.

43.text: And the man increased exceedingly, and had much cattle, and maidservants, and male servants, and camels, and asses.

1.text: And he heard the words of Laban's sons, saying, Jacob has taken away all that was our father's; and of that which was our father's has he got all this glory.

2.text: And Jacob beheld the countenance of Laban, and, behold, it was not toward him as before.

3.text: And the LORD said unto Jacob, Return unto the land of your fathers, and to your kindred; and I will be with you.

4.text: And Jacob sent and called Rachel and Leah to the field unto his flock,

5.text: And said unto them, I see your father's countenance, that it is not toward me as before; but the God of my father has been with me.

6.text: And all of you know that with all my power I have served your father.

7.text: And your father has deceived me, and changed my wages ten times; but God suffered him not to hurt me.

8.text: If he said thus, The speckled shall be your wages; then all the cattle bare speckled: and if he said thus, The striped with bands shall be your hire; then bare all the cattle striped with bands.

9.text: Thus God has taken away the cattle of your father, and given them to me.

10.text: And it came to pass at the time that the cattle conceived, that I lifted up mine eyes, and saw in a dream, and, behold, the rams which leaped upon the cattle were striped with bands, speckled, and greyed.

11.text: And the angel of God spoke unto me in a dream, saying, Jacob: And I said, Here am I.

12.text: And he said, Lift up now yours eyes, and see, all the rams which leap upon the cattle are striped with bands, speckled, and greyed: for I have seen all that Laban does unto you.

13.text: I am the God of Bethel, where you anointed the pillar, and where you vowed a vow unto me: now arise, get you out from this land, and return unto the land of your kindred.

14.text: And Rachel and Leah answered and said unto him, Is there yet any portion or inheritance for us in our father's house?

15.text: Are we not counted of him strangers? for he has sold us, and has quite devoured also our money.

16.text: For all the riches which God has taken from our father, that is ours, and our children's: now then, whatsoever God has said unto you, do.

17.text: Then Jacob rose up, and set his sons and his wives upon camels;

18.text: And he carried away all his cattle, and all his goods which he had got, the cattle of his getting, which he had got in Padanaram, in order to go to Isaac his father in the land of Canaan.

19.text: And Laban went to shear his sheep: and Rachel had stolen the images that were her father's.

20.text: And Jacob stole away unexpectedly to Laban the Syrian, in that he told him not that he fled.

21.text: So he fled with all that he had; and he rose up, and passed over the river, and set his face toward the mount Gilead.

22.text: And it was told Laban on the third day that Jacob was fled.

23.text: And he took his brethren with him, and pursued after him seven days' journey; and they overtook him in the mount Gilead.

24.text: And God came to Laban the Syrian in a dream by night, and said unto him, Take heed that you speak not to Jacob either good or bad.

25.text: Then Laban overtook Jacob. Now Jacob had pitched his tent in the mount: and Laban with his brethren pitched in the mount of Gilead.

26.text: And Laban said to Jacob, What have you done, that you have stolen away unexpectedly to me, and carried away my daughters, as captives taken with the sword?

27.text: Wherefore did you flee away secretly, and steal away from me; and did not tell me, that I might have sent you away with delight, and with songs, with timbrel, and with harp?

28.text: And have not suffered me to kiss my sons and my daughters? you have now done foolishly in so doing.

29.text: It is in the power of my hand to do you hurt: but the God of your father spoke unto me last night, saying, Take you heed that you speak not to Jacob either good or bad.

30.text: And now, though you would essentially be gone, because you sore longed after your father's house, yet wherefore have you stolen my gods?

31.text: And Jacob answered and said to Laban, Because I was afraid: for I said, Possibly you would take by force your daughters from me.

32.text: With whomsoever you find your gods, let him not live: before our brethren discern you what is yours with me, and take it to you. For Jacob knew not that Rachel had stolen them.

33.text: And Laban went into Jacob's tent, and into Leah's tent, and into the two maidservants' tents; but he found them not. Then went he out of Leah's tent, and entered into Rachel's tent.

34.text: Now Rachel had taken the images, and put them in the camel's furniture, and sat upon them. And Laban searched all the tent, but found them not.

35.text: And she said to her father, Let it not displease my lord that I cannot rise up before you; for the custom of women is upon me. And he searched but found not the images.

36.text: And Jacob was angry, and find fault with Laban: and Jacob answered and said to Laban, What is my trespass? what is my sin, that you have so hotly pursued after me?

37.text: Whereas you have searched all my stuff, what have you found of all your household stuff? set it here before my brethren and your brethren, that they may judge between us both.

38.text: This twenty years have I been with you; your ewes and your she goats have not cast their young, and the rams of your flock have I not eaten.

39.text: That which was torn of beasts I brought not unto you; I bare the loss of it; of my hand did you require it, whether stolen by day, or stolen by night.

40.text: Thus I was; in the day the drought consumed me, and the frost by night; and my sleep departed from mine eyes.

41.text: Thus have I been twenty years in your house; I served you fourteen years for your two daughters, and six years for your cattle: and you have changed my wages ten times.

42.text: Except the God of my father, the God of Abraham, and the fear of Isaac, had been with me, surely you had sent me away now empty. God has seen mine affliction and the labour of my hands, and rebuked you last night.

43.text: And Laban answered and said unto Jacob, These daughters are my daughters, and these children are my children, and these cattle are my cattle, and all that you see is mine: and what can I do this day unto these my daughters, or unto their children which they have born?

44.text: Now therefore come you, let us make a covenant, I and you; and let it be for a witness between me and you.

45.text: And Jacob took a stone, and set it up for a pillar.

46.text: And Jacob said unto his brethren, Gather stones; and they took stones, and made an heap: and they did eat there upon the heap.

47.text: And Laban called it Jegarsahadutha: but Jacob called it Galeed.

48.text: And Laban said, This heap is a witness between me and you this day. Therefore was the name of it called Galeed;

49.text: And Mizpah; for he said, The LORD watch between me and you, when we are absent one from another.

50.text: If you shall afflict my daughters, or if you shall take other wives beside my daughters, no man is with us; see, God is witness between me and you.

51.text: And Laban said to Jacob, Behold this heap, and behold this pillar, which I have cast between me and you:

52.text: This heap be witness, and this pillar be witness, that I will not pass over this heap to you, and that you shall not pass over this heap and this pillar unto me, for harm.

53.text: The God of Abraham, and the God of Nahor, the God of their father, judge between us. And Jacob swore by the fear of his father Isaac.

54.text: Then Jacob offered sacrifice upon the mount, and called his brethren to eat bread: and they did eat bread, and tarried all night in the mount.

55.text: And early in the morning Laban rose up, and kissed his sons and his daughters, and blessed them: and Laban departed, and returned unto his place.

1.text: And Jacob went on his way, and the angels of God met him.

2.text: And when Jacob saw them, he said, This is God's host: and he called the name of that place Mahanaim.

3.text: And Jacob sent messengers before him to Esau his brother unto the land of Seir, the country of Edom.

4.text: And he commanded them, saying, Thus shall all of you speak unto my lord Esau; Your servant Jacob says thus, I have sojourned with Laban, and stayed there until now:

5.text: And I have oxen, and asses, flocks, and male servants, and female servants: and I have sent to tell my lord, that I may find grace in your sight.

6.text: And the messengers returned to Jacob, saying, We came to your brother Esau, and also he comes to meet you, and four hundred men with him.

7.text: Then Jacob was greatly afraid and distressed: and he divided the people that was with him, and the flocks, and herds, and the camels, into two bands;

8.text: And said, If Esau come to the one company, and strike it, then the other company which is left shall escape.

9.text: And Jacob said, O God of my father Abraham, and God of my father Isaac, the LORD which said unto me, Return unto your country, and to your kindred, and I will deal well with you:

10.text: I am not worthy of the least of all the mercies, and of all the truth, which you have showed unto your servant; for with my staff I passed over this Jordan; and now I am become two bands.

11.text: Deliver me, I pray you, from the hand of my brother, from the hand of Esau: for I fear him, lest he will come and strike me, and the mother with the children.

12.text: And you said, I will surely do you good, and make your seed as the sand of the sea, which cannot be numbered for multitude.

13.text: And he lodged there that same night; and took of that which came to his hand a present for Esau his brother;

14.text: Two hundred she goats, and twenty he goats, two hundred ewes, and twenty rams,

15.text: Thirty milk giving camels with their colts, forty cattle, and ten bulls, twenty she asses, and ten foals.

16.text: And he delivered them into the hand of his servants, every drove by themselves; and said unto his servants, Pass over before me, and put a space between drove and drove.

17.text: And he commanded the foremost, saying, When Esau my brother meet you, and asks you, saying, Whose are you? and where go you? and whose are these before you?

18.text: Then you shall say, They be your servant Jacob's; it is a present sent unto my lord Esau: and, behold, also he is behind us.

19.text: And so commanded he the second, and the third, and all that followed the droves, saying, On this manner shall all of you speak unto Esau, when all of you find him.

20.text: And say all of you moreover, Behold, your servant Jacob is behind us. For he said, I will appease him with the present that goes before me, and afterward I will see his face; possibly he will accept of me.

21.text: So went the present over before him: and himself lodged that night in the company.

22.text: And he rose up that night, and took his two wives, and his two female servants, and his eleven sons, and passed over the ford Jabbok.

23.text: And he took them, and sent them over the brook, and sent over that he had.

24.text: And Jacob was left alone; and there wrestled a man with him until the breaking of the day.

25.text: And when he saw that he prevailed not against him, he touched the hollow of his thigh; and the hollow of Jacob's thigh was out of joint, as he wrestled with him.

26.text: And he said, Let me go, for the day breaks. And he said, I will not let you go, except you bless me.

27.text: And he said unto him, What is your name? And he said, Jacob.

28.text: And he said, Your name shall be called no more Jacob, but Israel: for as a prince have you power with God and with men, and have prevailed.

29.text: And Jacob asked him, and said, Tell me, I pray you, your name. And he said, Wherefore is it that you do ask after my name? And he blessed him there.

30.text: And Jacob called the name of the place Peniel: for I have seen God face to face, and my life is preserved.

31.text: And as he passed over Penuel the sun rose upon him, and he halted upon his thigh.

32.text: Therefore the children of Israel eat not of the sinew which shrank, which is upon the hollow of the thigh, unto this day: because he touched the hollow of Jacob's thigh in the sinew that shrank.

1.text: And Jacob lifted up his eyes, and looked, and, behold, Esau came, and with him four hundred men. And he divided the children unto Leah, and unto Rachel, and unto the two handmaids.

2.text: And he put the handmaids and their children foremost, and Leah and her children after, and Rachel and Joseph hindermost.

3.text: And he passed over before them, and bowed himself to the ground seven times, until he came near to his brother.

4.text: And Esau ran to meet him, and embraced him, and fell on his neck, and kissed him: and they wept.

5.text: And he lifted up his eyes, and saw the women and the children; and said, Who are those with you? And he said, The children which God has graciously given your servant.

6.text: Then the handmaidens came near, they and their children, and they bowed themselves.

7.text: And Leah also with her children came near, and bowed themselves: and after came Joseph near and Rachel, and they bowed themselves.

8.text: And he said, What mean you by all this drove which I met? And he said, These are to find grace in the sight of my lord.

9.text: And Esau said, I have enough, my brother; keep that you have unto yourself.

10.text: And Jacob said, Nay, I pray you, if now I have found grace in your sight, then receive my present at my hand: for therefore I have seen your face, as though I had seen the face of God, and you were pleased with me.

11.text: Take, I pray you, my blessing that is brought to you; because God has dealt graciously with me, and because I have enough. And he urged him, and he took it.

12.text: And he said, Let us take our journey, and let us go, and I will go before you.

13.text: And he said unto him, My lord knows that the children are tender, and the flocks and herds with young are with me: and if men should beat them one day, all the flock will die.

14.text: Let my lord, I pray you, pass over before his servant: and I will lead on softly, according as the cattle that goes before me and the children be able to endure, until I come unto my lord unto Seir.

15.text: And Esau said, Let me now leave with you some of the folk that are with me. And he said, What needs it? let me find grace in the sight of my lord.

16.text: So Esau returned that day on his way unto Seir.

17.text: And Jacob journeyed to Succoth, and built him an house, and made booths for his cattle: therefore the name of the place is called Succoth.

18.text: And Jacob came to Shalem, a city of Shechem, which is in the land of Canaan, when he came from Padanaram; and pitched his tent before the city.

19.text: And he bought a parcel of a field, where he had spread his tent, at the hand of the children of Hamor, Shechem's father, for an hundred pieces of money.

20.text: And he erected there an altar, and called it EleloheIsrael.

1.text: And Dinah the daughter of Leah, which she bare unto Jacob, went out to see the daughters of the land.

2.text: And when Shechem the son of Hamor the Hivite, prince of the country, saw her, he took her, and lay with her, and defiled her.

3.text: And his soul clave unto Dinah the daughter of Jacob, and he loved the damsel, and spoke kindly unto the damsel.

4.text: And Shechem spoke unto his father Hamor, saying, Get me this damsel to wife.

5.text: And Jacob heard that he had defiled Dinah his daughter: now his sons were with his cattle in the field: and Jacob held his peace until they were come.

6.text: And Hamor the father of Shechem went out unto Jacob to commune with him.

7.text: And the sons of Jacob came out of the field when they heard it: and the men were grieved, and they were very angry, because he had wrought folly in Israel in lying with Jacob's daughter: which thing ought not to be done.

8.text: And Hamor communed with them, saying, The soul of my son Shechem longs for your daughter: I pray you give her him to wife.

9.text: And make all of you marriages with us, and give your daughters unto us, and take our daughters unto you.

10.text: And all of you shall dwell with us: and the land shall be before you; dwell and trade all of you therein, and get you possessions therein.

11.text: And Shechem said unto her father and unto her brethren, Let me find grace in your eyes, and what all of you shall say unto me I will give.

12.text: Ask me never so much dowry and gift, and I will give according as all of you shall say unto me: but give me the damsel to wife.

13.text: And the sons of Jacob answered Shechem and Hamor his father deceitfully, and said, because he had defiled Dinah their sister:

14.text: And they said unto them, We cannot do this thing, to give our sister to one that is uncircumcised; for that were a reproach unto us:

15.text: But in this will we consent unto you: If all of you will be as we be, that every male of you be circumcised;

16.text: Then will we give our daughters unto you, and we will take your daughters to us, and we will dwell with you, and we will become one people.

17.text: But if all of you will not hearken unto us, to be circumcised; then will we take our daughter, and we will be gone.

18.text: And their words pleased Hamor, and Shechem Hamor's son.

19.text: And the young man deferred not to do the thing, because he had delight in Jacob's daughter: and he was more honourable than all the house of his father.

20.text: And Hamor and Shechem his son came unto the gate of their city, and communed with the men of their city, saying,

21.text: These men are peaceable with us; therefore let them dwell in the land, and trade therein; for the land, behold, it is large enough for them; let us take their daughters to us for wives, and let us give them our daughters.

22.text: Only herein will the men consent unto us in order to dwell with us, to be one people, if every male among us be circumcised, as they are circumcised.

23.text: Shall not their cattle and their substance and every beast of their's be our's? only let us consent unto them, and they will dwell with us.

24.text: And unto Hamor and unto Shechem his son hearkened all that went out of the gate of his city; and every male was circumcised, all that went out of the gate of his city.

25.text: And it came to pass on the third day, when they were sore, that two of the sons of Jacob, Simeon and Levi, Dinah's brethren, took each man his sword, and came upon the city boldly, and slew all the males.

26.text: And they slew Hamor and Shechem his son with the edge of the sword, and took Dinah out of Shechem's house, and went out.

27.text: The sons of Jacob came upon the slain, and spoiled the city, because they had defiled their sister.

28.text: They took their sheep, and their oxen, and their asses, and that which was in the city, and that which was in the field,

29.text: And all their wealth, and all their little ones, and their wives took they captive, and spoiled even all that was in the house.

30.text: And Jacob said to Simeon and Levi, All of you have troubled me to make me to stink among the inhabitants of the land, among the Canaanites and the Perizzites: and I being few in number, they shall gather themselves together against me, and slay me; and I shall be destroyed, I and my house.

31.text: And they said, Should he deal with our sister as with an harlot?

1.text: And God said unto Jacob, Arise, go up to Bethel, and dwell there: and make there an altar unto God, that appeared unto you when you fled from the face of Esau your brother.

2.text: Then Jacob said unto his household, and to all that were with him, Put away the strange gods that are among you, and be clean, and change your garments:

3.text: And let us arise, and go up to Bethel; and I will make there an altar unto God, who answered me in the day of my distress, and was with me in the way which I went.

4.text: And they gave unto Jacob all the strange gods which were in their hand, and all their earrings which were in their ears; and Jacob hid them under the oak which was by Shechem.

5.text: And they journeyed: and the terror of God was upon the cities that were round about them, and they did not pursue after the sons of Jacob.

6.text: So Jacob came to Luz, which is in the land of Canaan, that is, Bethel, he and all the people that were with him.

7.text: And he built there an altar, and called the place Elbethel: because there God appeared unto him, when he fled from the face of his brother.

8.text: But Deborah Rebekah's nurse died, and she was buried beneath Bethel under an oak: and the name of it was called Allonbachuth.

9.text: And God appeared unto Jacob again, when he came out of Padanaram, and blessed him.

10.text: And God said unto him, Your name is Jacob: your name shall not be called any more Jacob, but Israel shall be your name: and he called his name Israel.

11.text: And God said unto him, I am God Almighty: be fruitful and multiply; a nation and a company of nations shall be of you, and kings shall come out of your loins;

12.text: And the land which I gave Abraham and Isaac, to you I will give it, and to your seed after you will I give the land.

13.text: And God went up from him in the place where he talked with him.

14.text: And Jacob set up a pillar in the place where he talked with him, even a pillar of stone: and he poured a drink offering thereon, and he poured oil thereon.

15.text: And Jacob called the name of the place where God spoke with him, Bethel.

16.text: And they journeyed from Bethel; and there was but a little way to come to Ephrath: and Rachel travailed, and she had hard labour.

17.text: And it came to pass, when she was in hard labour, that the midwife said unto her, Fear not; you shall have this son also.

18.text: And it came to pass, as her soul was in departing, (for she died) that she called his name Benoni: but his father called him Benjamin.

19.text: And Rachel died, and was buried in the way to Ephrath, which is Bethlehem.

20.text: And Jacob set a pillar upon her grave: that is the pillar of Rachel's grave unto this day.

21.text: And Israel journeyed, and spread his tent beyond the tower of Edar.

22.text: And it came to pass, when Israel dwelt in that land, that Reuben went and lay with Bilhah his father's concubine: and Israel heard it. Now the sons of Jacob were twelve:

23.text: The sons of Leah; Reuben, Jacob's firstborn, and Simeon, and Levi, and Judah, and Issachar, and Zebulun:

24.text: The sons of Rachel; Joseph, and Benjamin:

25.text: And the sons of Bilhah, Rachel's handmaid; Dan, and Naphtali:

26.text: And the sons of Zilpah, Leah's handmaid: Gad, and Asher: these are the sons of Jacob, which were born to him in Padanaram.

27.text: And Jacob came unto Isaac his father unto Mamre, unto the city of Arbah, which is Hebron, where Abraham and Isaac sojourned.

28.text: And the days of Isaac were an hundred and fourscore years.

29.text: And Isaac gave up the spirit, and died, and was gathered unto his people, being old and full of days: and his sons Esau and Jacob buried him.

1.text: Now these are the generations of Esau, who is Edom.

2.text: Esau took his wives of the daughters of Canaan; Adah the daughter of Elon the Hittite, and Aholibamah the daughter of Anah the daughter of Zibeon the Hivite;

3.text: And Bashemath Ishmael's daughter, sister of Nebajoth.

4.text: And Adah bare to Esau Eliphaz; and Bashemath bare Reuel;

5.text: And Aholibamah bare Jeush, and Jaalam, and Korah: these are the sons of Esau, which were born unto him in the land of Canaan.

6.text: And Esau took his wives, and his sons, and his daughters, and all the persons of his house, and his cattle, and all his beasts, and all his substance, which he had got in the land of Canaan; and went into the country from the face of his brother Jacob.

7.text: For their riches were more than that they might dwell together; and the land wherein they were strangers could not bear them because of their cattle.

8.text: Thus dwelt Esau in mount Seir: Esau is Edom.

9.text: And these are the generations of Esau the father of the Edomites in mount Seir:

10.text: These are the names of Esau's sons; Eliphaz the son of Adah the wife of Esau, Reuel the son of Bashemath the wife of Esau.

11.text: And the sons of Eliphaz were Teman, Omar, Zepho, and Gatam, and Kenaz.

12.text: And Timna was concubine to Eliphaz Esau's son; and she bare to Eliphaz Amalek: these were the sons of Adah Esau's wife.

13.text: And these are the sons of Reuel; Nahath, and Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah: these were the sons of Bashemath Esau's wife.

14.text: And these were the sons of Aholibamah, the daughter of Anah the daughter of Zibeon, Esau's wife: and she bare to Esau Jeush, and Jaalam, and Korah.

15.text: These were dukes of the sons of Esau: the sons of Eliphaz the firstborn son of Esau; duke Teman, duke Omar, duke Zepho, duke Kenaz,

16.text: Duke Korah, duke Gatam, and duke Amalek: these are the dukes that came of Eliphaz in the land of Edom; these were the sons of Adah.

17.text: And these are the sons of Reuel Esau's son; duke Nahath, duke Zerah, duke Shammah, duke Mizzah: these are the dukes that came of Reuel in the land of Edom; these are the sons of Bashemath Esau's wife.

18.text: And these are the sons of Aholibamah Esau's wife; duke Jeush, duke Jaalam, duke Korah: these were the dukes that came of Aholibamah the daughter of Anah, Esau's wife.

19.text: These are the sons of Esau, who is Edom, and these are their dukes.

20.text: These are the sons of Seir the Horite, who inhabited the land; Lotan, and Shobal, and Zibeon, and Anah,

21.text: And Dishon, and Ezer, and Dishan: these are the dukes of the Horites, the children of Seir in the land of Edom.

22.text: And the children of Lotan were Hori and Hemam; and Lotan's sister was Timna.

23.text: And the children of Shobal were these; Alvan, and Manahath, and Ebal, Shepho, and Onam.

24.text: And these are the children of Zibeon; both Ajah, and Anah: this was that Anah that found the mules in the wilderness, as he fed the asses of Zibeon his father.

25.text: And the children of Anah were these; Dishon, and Aholibamah the daughter of Anah.

26.text: And these are the children of Dishon; Hemdan, and Eshban, and Ithran, and Cheran.

27.text: The children of Ezer are these; Bilhan, and Zaavan, and Akan.

28.text: The children of Dishan are these; Uz, and Aran.

29.text: These are the dukes that came of the Horites; duke Lotan, duke Shobal, duke Zibeon, duke Anah,

30.text: Duke Dishon, duke Ezer, duke Dishan: these are the dukes that came of Hori, among their dukes in the land of Seir.

31.text: And these are the kings that reigned in the land of Edom, before there reigned any king over the children of Israel.

32.text: And Bela the son of Beor reigned in Edom: and the name of his city was Dinhabah.

33.text: And Bela died, and Jobab the son of Zerah of Bozrah reigned in his position.

34.text: And Jobab died, and Husham of the land of Temani reigned in his position.

35.text: And Husham died, and Hadad the son of Bedad, who stroke Midian in the field of Moab, reigned in his position: and the name of his city was Avith.

36.text: And Hadad died, and Samlah of Masrekah reigned in his position.

37.text: And Samlah died, and Saul of Rehoboth by the river reigned in his position.

38.text: And Saul died, and Baalhanan the son of Achbor reigned in his position.

39.text: And Baalhanan the son of Achbor died, and Hadar reigned in his position: and the name of his city was Pau; and his wife's name was Mehetabel, the daughter of Matred, the daughter of Mezahab.

40.text: And these are the names of the dukes that came of Esau, according to their families, after their places, by their names; duke Timnah, duke Alvah, duke Jetheth,

41.text: Duke Aholibamah, duke Elah, duke Pinon,

42.text: Duke Kenaz, duke Teman, duke Mibzar,

43.text: Duke Magdiel, duke Iram: these be the dukes of Edom, according to their habitations in the land of their possession: he is Esau the father of the Edomites.

1.text: And Jacob dwelt in the land wherein his father was a stranger, in the land of Canaan.

2.text: These are the generations of Jacob. Joseph, being seventeen years old, was feeding the flock with his brethren; and the lad was with the sons of Bilhah, and with the sons of Zilpah, his father's wives: and Joseph brought unto his father their evil report.

3.text: Now Israel loved Joseph more than all his children, because he was the son of his old age: and he made him a coat of many colours.

4.text: And when his brethren saw that their father loved him more than all his brethren, they hated him, and could not speak peaceably unto him.

5.text: And Joseph dreamed a dream, and he told it his brethren: and they hated him yet the more.

6.text: And he said unto them, Hear, I pray you, this dream which I have dreamed:

7.text: For, behold, we were binding sheaves in the field, and, lo, my sheaf arose, and also stood upright; and, behold, your sheaves stood round about, and made reverence to my sheaf.

8.text: And his brethren said to him, Shall you indeed reign over us? or shall you indeed have dominion over us? And they hated him yet the more for his dreams, and for his words.

9.text: And he dreamed yet another dream, and told it his brethren, and said, Behold, I have dreamed a dream more; and, behold, the sun and the moon and the eleven stars made reverence to me.

10.text: And he told it to his father, and to his brethren: and his father rebuked him, and said unto him, What is this dream that you have dreamed? Shall I and your mother and your brethren indeed come to bow down ourselves to you to the earth?

11.text: And his brethren envied him; but his father observed the saying.

12.text: And his brethren went to feed their father's flock in Shechem.

13.text: And Israel said unto Joseph, Do not your brethren feed the flock in Shechem? come, and I will send you unto them. And he said to him, Here am I.

14.text: And he said to him, Go, I pray you, see whether it be well with your brethren, and well with the flocks; and bring me word again. So he sent him out of the vale of Hebron, and he came to Shechem.

15.text: And a certain man found him, and, behold, he was wandering in the field: and the man asked him, saying, What seek you?

16.text: And he said, I seek my brethren: tell me, I pray you, where they feed their flocks.

17.text: And the man said, They are departed behind; for I heard them say, Let us go to Dothan. And Joseph went after his brethren, and found them in Dothan.

18.text: And when they saw him far off, even before he came near unto them, they conspired against him to slay him.

19.text: And they said one to another, Behold, this dreamer comes.

20.text: Come now therefore, and let us slay him, and cast him into some pit, and we will say, Some evil beast has devoured him: and we shall see what will become of his dreams.

21.text: And Reuben heard it, and he delivered him out of their hands; and said, Let us not kill him.

22.text: And Reuben said unto them, Shed no blood, but cast him into this pit that is in the wilderness, and lay no hand upon him; that he might rid him out of their hands, to deliver him to his father again.

23.text: And it came to pass, when Joseph was come unto his brethren, that they stripped Joseph out of his coat, his coat of many colours that was on him;

24.text: And they took him, and cast him into a pit: and the pit was empty, there was no water in it.

25.text: And they sat down to eat bread: and they lifted up their eyes and looked, and, behold, a company of Ishmeelites came from Gilead with their camels bearing spices and balm and myrrh, going to carry it down to Egypt.

26.text: And Judah said unto his brethren, What profit is it if we slay our brother, and conceal his blood?

27.text: Come, and let us sell him to the Ishmeelites, and let not our hand be upon him; for he is our brother and our flesh. And his brethren were content.

28.text: Then there passed by Midianites merchantmen; and they drew and lifted up Joseph out of the pit, and sold Joseph to the Ishmeelites for twenty pieces of silver: and they brought Joseph into Egypt.

29.text: And Reuben returned unto the pit; and, behold, Joseph was not in the pit; and he rent his clothes.

30.text: And he returned unto his brethren, and said, The child is not; and I, where shall I go?

31.text: And they took Joseph's coat, and killed a kid of the goats, and dipped the coat in the blood;

32.text: And they sent the coat of many colours, and they brought it to their father; and said, This have we found: know now whether it be your son's coat or no.

33.text: And he knew it, and said, It is my son's coat; an evil beast has devoured him; Joseph is without doubt rent in pieces.

34.text: And Jacob rent his clothes, and put sackcloth upon his loins, and mourned for his son many days.

35.text: And all his sons and all his daughters rose up to comfort him; but he refused to be comforted; and he said, For I will go down into the grave unto my son mourning. Thus his father wept for him.

36.text: And the Midianites sold him into Egypt unto Potiphar, an officer of Pharaoh's, and captain of the guard.

1.text: And it came to pass at that time, that Judah went down from his brethren, and turned in to a certain Adullamite, whose name was Hirah.

2.text: And Judah saw there a daughter of a certain Canaanite, whose name was Shuah; and he took her, and went in unto her.

3.text: And she conceived, and bare a son; and he called his name Er.

4.text: And she conceived again, and bare a son; and she called his name Onan.

5.text: And she yet again conceived, and bare a son; and called his name Shelah: and he was at Chezib, when she bare him.

6.text: And Judah took a wife for Er his firstborn, whose name was Tamar.

7.text: And Er, Judah's firstborn, was wicked in the sight of the LORD; and the LORD slew him.

8.text: And Judah said unto Onan, Go in unto your brother's wife, and marry her, and raise up seed to your brother.

9.text: And Onan knew that the seed should not be his; and it came to pass, when he went in unto his brother's wife, that he spilled it on the ground, lest that he should give seed to his brother.

10.text: And the thing which he did displeased the LORD: wherefore he slew him also.

11.text: Then said Judah to Tamar his daughter in law, Remain a widow at your father's house, till Shelah my son be grown: for he said, Lest possibly he die also, as his brethren did. And Tamar went and dwelt in her father's house.

12.text: And in process of time the daughter of Shuah Judah's wife died; and Judah was comforted, and went up unto his sheepshearers to Timnath, he and his friend Hirah the Adullamite.

13.text: And it was told Tamar, saying, Behold your father in law goes up to Timnath to shear his sheep.

14.text: And she put her widow's garments off from her, and covered her with a vail, and wrapped herself, and sat in an open place, which is by the way to Timnath; for she saw that Shelah was grown, and she was not given unto him to wife.

15.text: When Judah saw her, he thought her to be an harlot; because she had covered her face.

16.text: And he turned unto her by the way, and said, Go to, I pray you, let me come in unto you; (for he knew not that she was his daughter in law.) And she said, What will you give me, that you may come in unto me?

17.text: And he said, I will send you a kid from the flock. And she said, Will you give me a pledge, till you send it?

18.text: And he said, What pledge shall I give you? And she said, Your signet, and your bracelets, and your staff that is in yours hand. And he gave it her, and came in unto her, and she conceived by him.

19.text: And she arose, and went away, and laid by her vail from her, and put on the garments of her widowhood.

20.text: And Judah sent the kid by the hand of his friend the Adullamite, to receive his pledge from the woman's hand: but he found her not.

21.text: Then he asked the men of that place, saying, Where is the harlot, that was openly by the way side? And they said, There was no harlot in this place.

22.text: And he returned to Judah, and said, I cannot find her; and also the men of the place said, that there was no harlot in this place.

23.text: And Judah said, Let her take it to her, lest we be shamed: behold, I sent this kid, and you have not found her.

24.text: And it came to pass about three months after, that it was told Judah, saying, Tamar your daughter in law has played the harlot; and also, behold, she is with child by whoredom. And Judah said, Bring her forth, and let her be burnt.

25.text: When she was brought forth, she sent to her father in law, saying, By the man, whose these are, am I with child: and she said, Discern, I pray you, whose are these, the signet, and bracelets, and staff.

26.text: And Judah acknowledged them, and said, She has been more righteous than I; because that I gave her not to Shelah my son. And he had sexual contact with her again no more.

27.text: And it came to pass in the time of her travail, that, behold, twins were in her womb.

28.text: And it came to pass, when she travailed, that the one put out his hand: and the midwife took and bound upon his hand a scarlet thread, saying, This came out first.

29.text: And it came to pass, as he drew back his hand, that, behold, his brother came out: and she said, How have you broken forth? this breach be upon you: therefore his name was called Pharez.

30.text: And afterward came out his brother, that had the scarlet thread upon his hand: and his name was called Zarah.

1.text: And Joseph was brought down to Egypt; and Potiphar, an officer of Pharaoh, captain of the guard, an Egyptian, bought him of the hands of the Ishmeelites, which had brought him down thither.

2.text: And the LORD was with Joseph, and he was a prosperous man; and he was in the house of his master the Egyptian.

3.text: And his master saw that the LORD was with him, and that the LORD made all that he did to prosper in his hand.

4.text: And Joseph found grace in his sight, and he served him: and he made him overseer over his house, and all that he had he put into his hand.

5.text: And it came to pass from the time that he had made him overseer in his house, and over all that he had, that the LORD blessed the Egyptian's house for Joseph's sake; and the blessing of the LORD was upon all that he had in the house, and in the field.

6.text: And he left all that he had in Joseph's hand; and he knew not ought he had, save the bread which he did eat. And Joseph was a goodly person, and well favoured.

7.text: And it came to pass after these things, that his master's wife cast her eyes upon Joseph; and she said, Lie with me.

8.text: But he refused, and said unto his master's wife, Behold, my master knows not what is with me in the house, and he has committed all that he has to my hand;

9.text: There is none greater in this house than I; neither has he kept back any thing from me but you, because you are his wife: how then can I do this great wickedness, and sin against God?

10.text: And it came to pass, as she spoke to Joseph day by day, that he hearkened not unto her, to lie by her, or to be with her.

11.text: And it came to pass about this time, that Joseph went into the house to do his business; and there was none of the men of the house there within.

12.text: And she caught him by his garment, saying, Lie with me: and he left his garment in her hand, and fled, and got him out.

13.text: And it came to pass, when she saw that he had left his garment in her hand, and was fled forth,

14.text: That she called unto the men of her house, and spoke unto them, saying, See, he has brought in an Hebrew unto us to mock us; he came in unto me to lie with me, and I cried with a loud voice:

15.text: And it came to pass, when he heard that I lifted up my voice and cried, that he left his garment with me, and fled, and got him out.

16.text: And she laid up his garment by her, until his lord came home.

17.text: And she spoke unto him according to these words, saying, The Hebrew servant, which you have brought unto us, came in unto me to mock me:

18.text: And it came to pass, as I lifted up my voice and cried, that he left his garment with me, and fled out.

19.text: And it came to pass, when his master heard the words of his wife, which she spoke unto him, saying, After this manner did your servant to me; that his wrath was kindled.
